level.heading: FORM OF NOTICE TO EMPLOYERS (§ 7-3207) The employer may prescribe a written notice form for the request of paid leave.uch form shall require only the employee’s name, employee identificationumber (if any), and minimal information needed (e.g., type of leave, or basiceason for leave) to show that the request comes within the Act’s coverage,nd the date(s) and time of the paid leave to be taken. The leave request form shall not be used as a substitute for medicalertification, unless such use is designated by the employer. If the employer prescribes a form, but the form is not reasonably available tohe employee, the employee may provide written notice to the employer by settingorth in writing the information required by §3207.1. If the employer has not prescribed a form, the employee may provide writtenotice to the employer by setting forth in writing the information required by3207.1.
